info.description: The accounting service is currently responsible for the General Ledger aspects of an Agency.
info.title: Accounting Service API

get.description: Retrieves a specific Account by ID.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the account to get

put.description: Patch the Account specified by the ID provided in the URI. The code, type, label, and groupId can be updated. The updated account will be returned.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Account to update

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: Request body of Account to update

delete.description: Deletes an Account by its ID

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the Account to delete.

get.description: Retrieve a single Journal Entry by its ID.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Journal Entry

patch.summary: Patch/Update a Journal Entry by ID
patch.description: Patch the Journal Entry by ID. The only field that can be updated is the `description` field.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Journal Entry

parameters.name: patch
parameters.description: A JSON Patch to update an existing Journal Entry

get.description: Retrieves an Account Group by its ID

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Account Group

put.description: Updates an Account group by ID. The fields that can be updated are `label`, `code`, `accountType`, and `parentId`.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Account Group to update

parameters.name: accountGroup
parameters.description: PUT to update an existing account group

delete.description: Deletes an Account Group by its ID

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Account Group to delete

post.description: Create the Journal specified within the body of this request. The created Journal will be returned.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: journal
parameters.description: A new Journal to be created

get.description: Retrieves the active Journal

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

get.description: Retrieves the Journal specified by the unique ID provided.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Journal to get

put.description: Update the Journal specified by the ID provided in the URI. The updated Journal will be returned.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Journal to replace

parameters.name: journal
parameters.description: Body of fields to be updated in an existing Journal

delete.description: Delete the Journal specified by the ID provided in the URI.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Journal to Delete

patch.description: Patch the Journal specified by the ID provided in the URI. The only field that can be updated is the `description` field. The updated Journal object will be returned.Must use the `add` operation.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Journal to patch

parameters.name: patch
parameters.description: A JSON Patch to update an existing journal

get.summary: Get Accounts by their codes within a Journal ID

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to include in the response

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of items to retrieve

post.summary: Create Journal Entry by Journal ID

parameters.description: ID of the Journal

parameters.name: journalEntryBody
parameters.description: A new journal entry to be created

get.summary: Filter Journal Entries by Date Range
get.description: Get a paged list of journal entries, within a single journal, filtered by a start date and an end date.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: journalId
parameters.description: The Journal ID to search for Journal Entries

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The starting date

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The ending date

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to include in the response

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of items to retrieve

get.summary: Filter Journal Entries by User who Created It
get.description: This will retrieve a paged list of journal entries, within a single journal, filtered by the user who created it.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: journalId
parameters.description: The Journal ID to search for entries

parameters.name: createdBy
parameters.description: The userId of who created the Journal Entry

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to include in the response

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of items to retrieve

get.summary: Get all journal entries by multi-filter.
get.description: This will retrieve a paged list of journal entries, within a single journal, with multiple filters applied. All request parameters are optional, though if either the 'startDate' or 'endDate' are provided, then the other will be required.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: journalId
parameters.description: The journal id to search for entries

parameters.name: createdBy
parameters.description: The string to search by userId

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The starting date

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The ending date

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to include in the response

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of items to retrieve

get.summary: Get All Journal Entries by Journal ID

parameters.name: journalId
parameters.description: ID of the Journal

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to include in the response

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of items to retrieve

parameters.name: page

get.description: This will retrieve a paged list of transactions, within a single journal, with multiple filters applied. All request parameters are optional.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: accountGroupId
parameters.description: The account group id to search by

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The account id to search by

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to include in the response

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of items to retrieve

parentId.description: The id of the account's parent

credits.description: The total amount of credits for this account group

debits.description: The total amount of debits for this account group

balance.description: The balance of the account group

code.description: The account code for accounting purposes

AccountBalanceV1.description: Balances for the accounts and account groups within a specified journal.

label.description: Descriptive label of the Account Group

code.description: The code of the Account Group. Must be between 6 and 10 digits.

parentId.description: ID of a parent Account Group that the current Account Group can be associated to.

accountType.description: The account type, valid values are ASSET, LIABILITY, EQUITY, INCOME, or EXPENSE

journalId.description: ID of the associated Journal for the Account Group

createdOn.description: Date when the Account Group was created.

updatedOn.description: Date when the Account Group was last modified.

createdBy.description: The user who created the account group

modifiedBy.description: The user who last modified the account

AccountGroupV1.description: A collection of accounts based on their business contribution or need. Assigned together for accounting clarity and ease of reporting.

entityId.description: Unique ID of the Entity for the account.

type.description: The type of Account denoted by the enum values.

code.description: The alias of the Account code. Typically a number between 6 and 10 digits. If an alias is not provided this will reflect the system code instead.

label.description: The alias of the Account name. Must be between 3 and 31 characters. If an alias is not provided this will reflect the system label instead.

systemCode.description: The system assigned code of the Account. Must be between 6 and 10 digits.

systemLabel.description: The system assigned descriptive label of the Account. Must be between 3 and 31 characters.

groupId.description: ID of the associated Account Group.

isArchived.description: Boolean that denotes if the Account has been archived. Is not included.

debitHolding.description: Determines whether the account is debit or credit holding.

isTrust.description: Determines whether the account is trust based. Defaults to false.

isDeferred.description: Determines whether the account uses deferred revenue. Defaults to false.

isSystemAccount.description: Whether the account is a default system account.

createdBy.description: The user who created the account.

modifiedBy.description: The user who last modified the account.

potentialUse.description: A description of the potential uses for the account

updatedOn.description: When the Account was last modified.

AccountV1.description: A formal record that represents the division of money or other monetary value by pre-defined rules set up by a business.

tenantId.description: ID of the Tenant in which the resource is stored

entityId.description: ID of the Entity in which the resource is stored

error.description: This field will contain information about the error if one occurred

requestId.description: The unique ID of this request.

spanId.description: The unique ID of the span.

traceId.description: The unique ID of the trace.

memo.description: Memo line for the individual Transaction. 64 character max. Can be updated.

amount.description: Amount of money in the Transaction.

transactionNumber.description: The number of the transaction, sequentially identified per journal.

accountCode.description: The account code the transaction is associated with.

accountName.description: Name of the account the transaction is associated with.

journalEntryId.description: Unique ID of the Journal Entry the Transaction is associated with.

accountId.description: Unique ID of the Account the Transaction is associated with.

journalId.description: Unique id of the journal the transaction is associated with.

createdBy.description: ID of the user that created the Transaction

modifiedBy.description: ID of the user that last modified the Transaction

createdOn.description: Date of the transaction being created.

updatedOn.description: Date of the transaction last being updated.

reconciledOn.description: Date of the transaction being reconciled. Null means it has not been reconciled.

EntryTransactionV1.description:
This request/response object will be sent with a JournalEntryV1 object. It contains
    less information than a full TransactionV1 response object. The JournalEntryV1
    object will already contain "description" and Journal Entry "type" fields.

id.description: Unique ID of the Journal Entry.

type.description: The type of journal entry denoted by the enum values. This is value cannot be changed. Manual entries will be auto populated with MANUAL type.

description.description: Description of Journal Entry. Must be between 3 and 64 characters.

journalId.description: Unique ID of the Journal the Journal Entry is associated with.

createdBy.description: ID of the user who created the Journal Entry.

modifiedBy.description: ID of the user who last modified the Journal Entry.

createdOn.description: Date when the Journal Entry was created.

updatedOn.description: Date when the Journal Entry was updated.

postedOn.description: Post date of the Journal Entry.

transactions.description: List of transactions associated with the Journal Entry. This is value cannot be changed. Must contain at least two transactions. The sum of all transaction amounts should equal 0.

JournalEntryV1.description: A notation made in your general ledger journal recording transaction(s).

fiscalMonth.description: A number between 1 and 12 that correlates to a month

id.description: The unique ID of the journal.

label.description: Descriptive label of the journal. Must be between 3 and 24 characters in length.

journalType.description: The `type` of journal. The type has to be one of the enum values provided.

createdBy.description: The user who created the journal

modifiedBy.description: The user who last modified the journal

updatedOn.description: When the journal was last modified.

JournalV1.description: A "book" containing all original entries of daily financial transactions.

method.description: The method of paging that this pagingInfo contains

numberOfElements.description: The number of data elements in this response.

page.description: The page number of the response.

pageSize.description: The page size of this response.

totalPages.description: The total number of pages, based on the pageSize and totalElements

error.description: This field will contain information about the error if one occurred

requestId.description: The unique ID of this request.

spanId.description: The unique ID of the span.

traceId.description: The unique ID of the trace.

error.description: This field will contain information about the error if one occurred

traceId.description: The unique ID of the trace.

spanId.description: The unique ID of the span.

traceId.description: The unique ID of the trace.

schedules.description: The list of schedules to handle aging

ScheduleSettingsV1.description: The settings used by the accounting service to handle aging schedules

ScheduleV1.description: The range of days defining an individual schedule

error.description: This field will contain information about the error if one occurred

requestId.description: The unique ID of this request.

spanId.description: The unique ID of the span.

traceId.description: The unique ID of the trace.

memo.description: Memo line for the individual Transaction. 64 character max. Can be updated.

amount.description: Amount of money in the Transaction.

transactionNumber.description: The number of the transaction, sequentially identified per journal.

accountCode.description: The account code the transaction is associated with.

accountName.description: Name of the account the transaction is associated with.

journalEntryDescription.description: Description of the Journal Entry in which the Transaction is associated with.

journalEntryType.description: The Journal Entry type the Transaction is associated with.

journalEntryId.description: Unique ID of the Journal Entry the Transaction is associated with.

accountId.description: Unique ID of the Account the Transaction is associated with.

journalId.description: Unique id of the journal the transaction is associated with.

createdBy.description: ID of the user that created the Transaction

modifiedBy.description: ID of the user that last modified the Transaction

createdOn.description: Date of the transaction being created.

updatedOn.description: Date of the transaction last being updated.

reconciledOn.description: Date of the transaction being reconciled. Null means it has not been reconciled.

TransactionV1.description:
This TransactionV1 object contains more detailed information about the transaction,
    including everything from EntryTransactionV1. This also includes the Journal Entry
    "description" as "journalEntryDescription" as well as the Journal Entry "type" as "journalEntryType".
    This is the request/response object used when retrieving/updating transactions only.
